title: Docket Analytics and Reports
text: entire docket pulled project, 1,000 document per search limit exceeded dockets pulled one request. reduce impact limit, nrcadams::search_long_docket used break one long search many smaller searches.
code: combined_dockets = nrcadams::docket_codex |>   dplyr::pull(DocketNumber) |>   nrcadams::search_long_docket(number_of_intervals = 30) |>   nrcadams::hyperlink_file_to_name() |>   dplyr::left_join(nrcadams::docket_codex) |>   dplyr::select(-c(Company, DocketNumber, `ML Number`)) |>   dplyr::filter(!is.na(Project)) #> Searching with the following URL: #> title: Docket Analytics and Reports
text: many document types coded ADAMS effectively show plot (.e., > 180). result, Type field binned facilitate bar plot various reactor applications. last update plot 2023-01-13 15:15:31. data can also plotted bars unstacked.
code: library(ggplot2) library(plotly) docket_types = combined_dockets |>   dplyr::mutate(     Project = factor(Project, levels = docket_count |> dplyr::pull(Project)),   ) |>   nrcadams::simplify_type()  type_count = docket_types |>   dplyr::filter(NLWR) |>   dplyr::count(Type, sort = TRUE) |>   dplyr::arrange(n)   plt = docket_types |>   dplyr::mutate(Type = factor(Type, levels = type_count |> dplyr::pull(Type))) |>   ggplot() +     geom_bar(aes(y = Project, fill = Type)) +     theme_bw() +     scale_fill_brewer(palette="Set1") +     labs(       title = "Advanced Reactor ADAMS Documents",       subtitle =  paste("as of", Sys.Date())     ) +     xlab("Document Count")  plt |> ggplotly(tooltip = c("Type", "count")) plt = docket_types |>   dplyr::mutate(Type = factor(Type, levels = type_count |> dplyr::pull(Type))) |>   ggplot() +     geom_bar(aes(y = Project, fill = Type), position = position_dodge()) +     theme_bw() +     scale_fill_brewer(palette="Set1") +     labs(       title = "Advanced Reactor ADAMS Documents",       subtitle =  paste("as of", Sys.Date())     ) +     xlab("Document Count")  plt |> ggplotly(tooltip = c("Type", "count"))

title: Docket Analytics and Reports
text: cumulative number documents given ADAMS docket also presented function document date. plot shows number documents submitted docket. plot starts 2018 Shine docket singularly dominates plot pre-2018 time frame. Plot order sorted highest number documents, NuScale 50 MWe Part 52 lowest number documents, MSRR Part 50. data linear scale: data y axis semi log scale:
code: library(ggplot2) library(plotly) grouped_NLWR_dockets = combined_dockets |>   dplyr::group_by(Project) |>   dplyr::arrange(`Publish Date`) |>   dplyr::mutate(     Project = factor(Project, levels = docket_count |> dplyr::pull(Project)),     count = 1,     `Document Count` = cumsum(count)     ) |>   dplyr::filter(`Document Date` > lubridate::ymd("2018-01-01"))  plt = grouped_NLWR_dockets |>   ggplot() +     geom_step(aes(x = `Publish Date`, y = `Document Count`, color = Project)) +     theme_bw() +     labs(       title = "Advanced Reactor ADAMS Documents",       subtitle =  paste("as of", Sys.Date())     ) plt |> ggplotly() plt = plt + scale_y_log10()  plt |> ggplotly()

Part 70 Natrium Pre-Application UIUC HTGR Pre-Application eVinci Pre-Application IMSR Pre-Application BWRX-300 Pre-Application SMR-160 Pre-Application NuScale 50 MWe Part 52 NuScale 77 MWe Pre-Application KP-X Pre-Application Hermes Part 50 Oklo Pre-Application Aurora Part 52

title: Docket Search
text: One confusing aspects NRC’s document repository NRC assigns docket numbers. pre-application engagement, companies assigned docket number starts 999. NRC accepts companies license application review, NRC assign docket number based upon type license. example, companies applying traditional two stage license Part 50 docket number begins 050. Companies applying combined operating license Part 52 docket number begins 052. Even applicant receives docket number given facility design, applicant may still submit documents pre-application docket information support future licensing submittals.
code: nrcadams::docket_codex |>   DT::datatable(     caption = "Exported Docket Numbers in the `nrcadams` Package.",     filter = list(position = 'top', clear = TRUE, plain = FALSE)     )

what: Keeping Up to Date with a Docket
title: Docket Search
text: open regulatory, NRC required publicly provide non-proprietary non-export controlled information public. applicant submits proprietary document, NRC post non-proprietary portions document ADAMS. NRC typically strives ensure enough information public sphere justify licensing actions. keep --date ACU’s MSRR license, best search pre-application docketed information.
code: nrcadams::docket_codex |> dplyr::filter(Company == "ACU") |> dplyr::pull(DocketNumber) |> nrcadams::search_docket(days_back = 60) |> dplyr::mutate(Title = paste0("", Title, '')) |> dplyr::select(-URL) |> DT::datatable( caption = "The last 60 Days of the MSRR's Posted Licensing Documents.", filter = list(position = 'top', clear = TRUE, plain = FALSE), escape = FALSE ) #> Searching with the following URL: #> https://adams.nrc.gov/wba/services/search/advanced/nrc?q=(mode:sections,sections:(filters:(public-library:!t),properties_search_any:!(!(DocketNumber,eq,'99902088',''),!(DocketNumber,eq,'05000610','')),properties_search_all:!(!(PublishDatePARS,gt,'11/14/2022',''))))&qn=New&tab=advanced-search-pars&z=0 #> : 0.259 sec elapsed #> #> This search returned: 4 files.

what: Filtering a Docket for Actual Information
title: Docket Search
text: given docket include email correspondence addition reports safety evaluations. Generally, letters emails noise signal can filtered search results. Instead mucking around ADAMS API filter results, simpler use dplyr::filter filter returned results.
code: nrcadams::docket_codex |> dplyr::filter(Company == "X-Energy") |> dplyr::pull(DocketNumber) |> nrcadams::search_docket() |> dplyr::filter( !stringr::str_detect(Type, "E-Mail"), !stringr::str_detect(Type, "Letter") )|> dplyr::mutate(Title = paste0("", Title, '')) |> dplyr::select(-URL) |> DT::datatable( caption = "X-Energy's Pre-Applicaion Docket without Letters and Emails.", filter = list(position = 'top', clear = TRUE, plain = FALSE), escape = FALSE ) #> Searching with the following URL: #> https://adams.nrc.gov/wba/services/search/advanced/nrc?q=(mode:sections,sections:(filters:(public-library:!t),properties_search_any:!(!(DocketNumber,eq,'99902071',''),!(DocketNumber,eq,'07007027',''))))&qn=New&tab=advanced-search-pars&z=0 #> : 1.429 sec elapsed #> #> This search returned: 249 files.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Matthew Denman. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Denman M (2023). nrcadams: Pulls Data NRC's ADAMS database. R package version 0.1.2.0000, https://mrdenman-nuclear.github.io/nrcadams/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {nrcadams: Pulls Data from NRC's ADAMS database},   author = {Matthew Denman},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.2.0000},   url = {https://mrdenman-nuclear.github.io/nrcadams/}, }

what: Pulls Data from NRC's ADAMS database
title: Pulls Data from NRC's ADAMS database
text: R package used pull data NRC’s ADAMS document repository. ever want keep track recent back forth applicants NRC find NRC web based ADAMS searches cumbersome? , package might !

title: Pulls Data from NRC's ADAMS database
text: R package based tidyverse, R tidyverse installation recommended. Web based ADAMS results processed xml, xml2 package prerequisite. package programmed using base R pipes, versions R greater 4.1 required. Please install package using remotes: package unlikely published CRAN.
code: remotes::install_github("mrdenman-nuclear/nrcadams")

title: Pulls Data from NRC's ADAMS database
text: nrcadams package fairly limited time. key functionality runs search_docket. least one docket number required, can filter results specifying many days past want search well search terms. function outputs tibble results including URLs documents.
code: ACU_MSRR <- c(99902088, 05000610) ACU_MSRR |>   nrcadams::search_docket(     days_back = 20,     search_term = "Acceptance"     )

Part 70           X-Energy                        7007027 TRUE  #>  6 Natrium Pre-Application        GE/TerraPower                  99902100 TRUE  #>  7 UIUC HTGR Pre-Application      UCUI                           99902094 TRUE  #>  8 eVinci Pre-Application         Westinghouse                   99902079 TRUE  #>  9 IMSR Pre-Application           Terrestrial Energy             99902076 TRUE  #> 10 BWRX-300 Pre-Application       GE                             99900003 FALSE #> 11 SMR-160 Pre-Application        Holtec                         99902049 FALSE #> 12 NuScale 50 MWe Part 52         NuScale                         5200048 FALSE #> 13 NuScale 77 MWe Pre-Application NuScale                        99902078 FALSE #> 14 KP-X Pre-Application           Kairos Power                   99902069 TRUE  #> 15 Hermes Part 50                 Kairos Power                    5007513 TRUE  #> 16 Oklo Pre-Application           Oklo                           99902095 TRUE  #> 17 Aurora Part 52                 Oklo                            5200049 TRUE

code: search_docket(   DocketNumber,   search_term = NA,   days_back = NA,   start_date = NA,   end_date = NA,   document_type = NA )

title: Conduct ADAMS Search on Docket Numbers — search_docket
text: https://www.nrc.gov/site-help/developers/wba-api-developer-guide.pdf

title: Conduct ADAMS Search on Docket Numbers — search_docket
text: DocketNumber dbl/vector: Docket number (numbers) searched ADAMS search_term chr: search term desired. Default nothing (.e., NA) days_back dbl: Length time search extends days since document published ADAMS? Default time (.e, NA). used start_date end_date. start_date chr: earliest date (ymd) search results returned. used days_back. end_date chr: latest date (ymd) search results returned. used days_back. document_type chr: Type ADAMS document

title: Conduct ADAMS Search on Docket Numbers — search_docket
text: tibble search results

title: Conduct ADAMS Search on Docket Numbers — search_docket

what: Conduct a lengthy search on Docket Numbers — search_long_docket
title: Conduct a lengthy search on Docket Numbers — search_long_docket
text: Individual ADAMS searches limited 1000 results, can make searches lengthy difficult. Additionally, long ADAMS searches can take 10 seconds complete may trigger connection timeout systems.

title: Conduct a lengthy search on Docket Numbers — search_long_docket
code: search_long_docket(   DocketNumber,   search_term = NA,   number_of_intervals = 5,   start_date = "2013-1-1",   document_type = NA )

title: Conduct a lengthy search on Docket Numbers — search_long_docket
text: https://www.nrc.gov/site-help/developers/wba-api-developer-guide.pdf

title: Conduct a lengthy search on Docket Numbers — search_long_docket
text: DocketNumber dbl/vector: Docket number (numbers) searched ADAMS search_term chr: search term desired. Default nothing (.e., NA) number_of_intervals dbl: maximum number searches conducted start_date chr: earliest date (ymd) search results returned. document_type chr: Type ADAMS document

title: Conduct a lengthy search on Docket Numbers — search_long_docket
text: tibble search results

title: Conduct a lengthy search on Docket Numbers — search_long_docket
text: avoid problems, wrapper script conducts multiple searches today back starting point time. number searches set num_interval. example, today 2020/1/1 starting date 2010/1/1 number_of_intervals set 2, script conduct two searches, one 2010 2015 2015 2020. search results combined output user.
